name: DEFINE FIELD
description: This command is used to ‘create’ a field that will be used only within the current program (or subsequent programs that are called from this program). This is not a field that is part of a standard TAS Professional 5.1 file.
syntax:
DEFINE FIELD
DEFINE field_name_list TYPE type SIZE display_size DEC decimal_chrs
ARRAY num_array_elements PICT picture DUP dup_field UP RESET LOCAL INIT
init_val

parameters.name: field_name_list
parameters.description: The name or names of the field(s) being defined. Must conform to standard field name requirements. You may define a maximum of 10 fields in one DEFINE command. Each of the fields will have the same specifications.

parameters.name: TYPE
parameters.description:
Optional - The type of the field being added. Must conform to standard field type requirements. If you don’t specify a field type, the default value is N. The field name types are:
A Alphanumeric
N Numeric
D Date
T Time
I Integer
B Byte
F F type pointer
P P type pointer
R Record number

parameters.name: SIZE
parameters.description: The size of the field being defined.

parameters.name: DEC
parameters.description: The number of decimal characters to allocate for the field.

parameters.name: decimal_chrs
parameters.description: The number of decimal characters to display (used with numeric fields).

parameters.name: ARRAY
parameters.description: ARRAY num_array_elements - The array feature allowing multiple elements of the field.

parameters.name: num_array_elements
parameters.description: The number of elements in the array.

parameters.name: PICT
parameters.description: PICT picture - The editing picture for the field.

parameters.name: picture
parameters.description: The PICTURE specification for the field.

parameters.name: DUP
parameters.description: DUP dup_field - Duplicate the field for alignment.

parameters.name: UP
parameters.description: UP - Indicates the field or operation involves upper-level or upward referencing.

parameters.name: RESET
parameters.description: RESET - Cares the reset of the field.

parameters.name: init_val
parameters.description: init_val - The initial value for the field.
